page.title: 04Firs Farm (arable)
page.content: Firs Farm has changed in the past years,there used to be 6-7 small fields but now there is one big one. The tractors couldn't get through the small gates so the farmer cut down all the hedgerows and made all the small fields in to a big one.Another thing was,there used to be big barns made from brick but now to save money people use metal,plastic or wood.In the fields of Graham Walker there used to be clay drains.Nowadays farmers have plastic drains because they are cheaper.Mr Walker grows all sorts of crops.There's wheat,barley,potatoes and a new crop called linseed.A daily routine for Mr Walker is something the weather decides.If it rains, indoor jobs are done but if the weather stays fine, outdoor jobs are done.The bit Mr Walker likes about farming is the open air.He has 350 acres of land.
